ticket.title: Rake test fails on a fresh clone on OSX.
ticket.original-body: I've tried this on both system ruby (I'm on OSX 10.6.6, so that is using ruby 1.8.7 (2009-06-12 patchlevel 174) [universal-darwin10.0]) and on ruby 1.9.2p136. I'm using rvm for both of these. Both are failing in activerecord.
ticket.latest-body: I've tried this on both system ruby (I'm on OSX 10.6.6, so that is using ruby 1.8.7 (2009-06-12 patchlevel 174) [universal-darwin10.0]) and on ruby 1.9.2p136. I'm using rvm for both of these. Both are failing in activerecord.
ticket.original-body-html: I've tried this on both system ruby (I'm on OSX 10.6.6, so that is using ruby 1.8.7 (2009-06-12 patchlevel 174) [universal-darwin10.0]) and on ruby 1.9.2p136. I'm using rvm for both of these. Both are failing in activerecord.

version.body: I've tried this on both system ruby (I'm on OSX 10.6.6, so that is using ruby 1.8.7 (2009-06-12 patchlevel 174) [universal-darwin10.0]) and on ruby 1.9.2p136. I'm using rvm for both of these. Both are failing in activerecord.

version.title: Rake test fails on a fresh clone on OSX.

version.body: Could you please include the error or relevant output that you get?
version.body-html: Could you please include the error or relevant output that you get?
version.title: Rake test fails on a fresh clone on OSX.

version.body: For running rake test in 1.9.2@136, in the activerecord folder: https://gist.github.com/810662 It said Errors running test_mysql, test_mysql2, test_postgresql But I had done bundle install --without db; so I didn't think those should be tested.
version.body-html:
For running rake test in 1.9.2@136, in the activerecord folder: https://gist.github.com/810662
It said Errors running test_mysql, test_mysql2, test_postgresql
But I had done bundle install --without db; so I didn't think those should be tested.
version.title: Rake test fails on a fresh clone on OSX.

version.body: I don't think it makes sense for the test suite to be aware of what is bundled and what isn't. If you don't bundle the :db group then it's your responsibility not to run the activerecord test suite. For convenience you could just write a small script for your use that switches to each components directory (eg: activerecord, activemodel etc) and run rake. That way you can run all tests except for activerecord.
version.body-html: I don't think it makes sense for the test suite to be aware of what is bundled and what isn't. If you don't bundle the :db group then it's your responsibility not to run the activerecord test suite. For convenience you could just write a small script for your use that switches to each components directory (eg: activerecord, activemodel etc) and run rake. That way you can run all tests except for activerecord.
version.title: Rake test fails on a fresh clone on OSX.
